page.title: 10The Council Offices, Codsall
page.content: Children from Codsall Middle School visited the Offices and found out the following information. The South Staffordshire District was formed in l974 following local government re-organisation and it was decided to close the old Cannock District Council offices at Penkridge and those of the former Seisdon District Council at Wombourne and transfer all departments to new offices to be built in centrally located Codsall. They were opened in 1976 at a cost of about 1 000 000 pounds. About 200 people are employed in the offices which deal with these services. The Health Department checks that shops serve food in hygienic conditions and also tries to prevent damage to health from air pollution by checking on fumes from factories. The Engineers Dept. repair and build sewers and co operate with the water board.
